intro: Vincetoxicum tanakae var. glabrescens, commonly known as Japanese snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers that are typically followed by follicles containing toxic seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
